required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: HI Study to Assess and Compare the Pharmacokinetic Parameters of MD1003 in Hepatic Impaired Patients and Healthy Subjects
clinical_study.official_title: Open Label, Phase I Study to Assess and Compare the Pharmacokinetic Parameters After Single Oral Administration of MD1003 100 mg in Hepatic Impaired Patients and Healthy Subjects With Normal Hepatic Function

brief_summary.textblock:
This is a Phase 1, multicentric, open-label,two arms to assess and compare the effect of single oral administration of MD1003 on the pharmacokinetic parameters in hepatic impaired patients and healthy subjects with normal hepatic function.
The planned enrollment is 16 subjects (8 impaired patients and 8 healthy subjects).

detailed_description.textblock:
The study is a multicentric, open label, phase I, two arms study to compare pharmacokinetics of MD1003 after a single oral dose of MD1003 100 mg in eight (8) healthy male/female subjects and eight (8) male/female patients of moderate Child Pugh category. Healthy subjects and patients will receive a single oral dose of MD1003 100 mg. The healthy subjects will match with impaired hepatic function patients on ethnic group, sex, age (+/- 10 years) and BMI (+/- 20%).
Participants will be admitted into the Clinical Research Units (CRU) on Day-3. On the morning of Day 1, subjects will receive a single 100 mg oral dose of MD1003 following an overnight fast (i.e., at least 10 hours). Participants will be confined to the CRU until discharge on Day 8, with PK blood sample draws for measurement of MD1003 and its main metabolites being taken throughout the confinement (Predose, 0.5, 1, 1.5, 2, 2.5, 3, 4, 6, 8, 12, 18, 24, 36, 48, 72, 96, 120, 144, 168h post dose). A Follow up post study visit will occur on Day 14 (± 2 days).
Adverse events (AEs), clinical laboratory evaluations, vital signs assessments, 12-lead electrocardiograms (ECGs), and physical examination (PE) findings will be monitored at Screening and at specified times during the study. All AEs will be recorded throughout the study (i.e., from signing of the Informed Consent Form until Study Completion).
The Study Completion is defined as the last subject's end-of-study assessment.

clinical_study.why_stopped: Due to other Phase 3 trial failure to meet primary endpoint

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Open label, Parallel-group, Single oral dose
study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Area under curve from dosing time to last measurment (AUC (0-t)) for MD1003
Area under curve from dosing tme to infinity (AUC(0-∞)) for MD1003
Observed maximum plasma concentration (Cmax) for MD1003
Measurement of concentration of Biotin sulfoxide

secondary_outcome.measure: Measurement of plasma elimination half-life (t1/2) for MD1003
Measurement of time to reach observed maximum plasma concentration (tmax) for MD1003
Measurement of apparent volume of distribution (Vd/F) for MD1003
Measurement of elimination rate constant (Kel) for MD1003
Measurement of percentage of extrapolated AUCinf (%AUCextra) for MD1003
Measurement of apparent clearance (CL/F) for MD1003
Area under curve from dosing time to last measurment (AUC (0-t)) for Bisnorbiotin
Area under curve from dosing time to last measurment (AUC (0-t)) for Biotin sulfoxide
Area under curve from dosing tme to infinity (AUC(0-∞)) for Bisnorbiotin
Area under curve from dosing tme to infinity (AUC(0-∞)) for Biotin sulfoxide
Observed maximum plasma concentration (Cmax) for Bisnorbiotin
Observed maximum plasma concentration (Cmax) for Biotin sulfoxide
Measurement of time to reach observed maximum plasma concentration (tmax) for Bisnorbiotin
Measurement of time to reach observed maximum plasma concentration (tmax) for Biotin sulfoxide
Measurement of plasma elimination half-life (t1/2) Bisnorbiotin
Measurement of plasma elimination half-life (t1/2) Biotin sulfoxide
Measurement of elimination rate constant (Kel) for Bisnorbiotin
Measurement of elimination rate constant (Kel) for Biotin sulfoxide
Measurement of percentage of extrapolated AUCinf (%AUCextra) for Bisnorbiotin
Measurement of percentage of extrapolated AUCinf (%AUCextra) for Biotin sulfoxide

clinical_study.condition: Hepatic Impairment of Moderate Child Pugh Category

arm_group.description: 8 patients with hepatic impairment of moderate Child Pugh category
Healthy volunteers will be matched with impaired hepatic function patients

intervention.description: Single oral dose administration of MD1003 at Day 1
